summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between FBI personnel and U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutors regarding the scanning and shipment of case records from two FBI case files (72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062) related to the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistical challenges, deadlines, and the volume of evidence (approximately 23 boxes).

events.title: Shipment of Evidence Boxes
events.description: Boxes of case records were scheduled to be shipped via FedEx from New York to Virginia for scanning.

events.title: Deadline Negotiation for Scanning
events.description: FBI personnel request an extension for the scanning deadline from July 10 to July 16 due to delays in receiving boxes and the July 4 holiday.

keyFacts: The document references two specific FBI case files related to the Epstein investigation: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062.
Approximately 23 boxes of paper records were being processed, indicating a large volume of evidence.
The emails show coordination and time pressure between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in mid-2019.
All personal names and email addresses in the correspondence are redacted.
The shipment tracking number provided is 4744 7647 0418.
